definition: to pile up/to heap up/a mass/pile/heap/stack/large amount
to put/to place/to release/to free/to let go/to let out/to set off (fireworks)

sentences.english: According to Thoman, food waste and yard waste are currently all dumped in a pile together.
sentences.chinese: 托曼说，此刻食物垃圾和庭院销毁物都堆放在一路。

sentences.english: All refractory items are to be placed lot wise and any damage done will be to the contractor's responsibility.
sentences.chinese: 所有耐材应批量堆放，如果产生损坏则由承包商负责。

sentences.english: The floor was stacked high with bales of dry goods.
sentences.chinese: 地板上高高地堆放着许多包纺织品。

sentences.english: What was left were sacks and sacks and sacks of money piled everywhere.
sentences.chinese: 王国里只剩下一口袋一口袋的钱，堆放得到处都是。

sentences.english: Most of it had been sitting in the yard long enough to turn a soft gray.
sentences.chinese: 大多数堆放很久都变成灰色了。

sentences.english: we just piled up all the groceries in the trunk of the car and drive home.
sentences.chinese: 我们会把杂货堆放在车的后备箱里，然后开车回家。

sentences.english: The cement is stacked up over there, and it looks like rain.
sentences.chinese: 水泥堆放在那边，可天看起来要下雨了。

sentences.english: He continues to carefully stack his winnings into even piles.
sentences.chinese: 他继续仔细地把赢来的钱堆放成整整齐齐的几堆。

sentences.english: According to Thoman, food waste and yard waste are currently all dumped in a pile together.
sentences.chinese: 托曼说，现在食品垃圾和庭院废弃物都堆放在一起。

sentences.english: Cows were kept on the first floor and the one above was used to store hay.
sentences.chinese: 牛关在底层，而上面的一层则被用作堆放干草。

sentences.english: The unbound sheets of paper were piled up on the table.
sentences.chinese: 还没有装订成册的论文稿件堆放在桌子上。

sentences.english: Stagger pile of the products stagger. The height of each pile should be no more than 6 levels.
sentences.chinese: 产品堆放时须纵横叠放，叠高层数不得超过6层。

sentences.english: I suggest you commence the stowage from the inside out.
sentences.chinese: 我建议你们从里向外堆放。

sentences.english: Meg was already covering the buckwheats, and piling the bread into one big plate.
sentences.chinese: 梅格已动手把荞麦盖上，把面包堆放到一个大盘子里。

sentences.english: Some people owned two-storey houses with the ground floor used as shop and the second floor for living or storing.
sentences.chinese: 也有的是一楼一底，楼下为店，楼上住家或堆放货物。

sentences.english: Rubbish should be put into the dustbin.
sentences.chinese: 垃圾应堆放在垃圾箱里。

definition: junk/items of no value/various bits and bobs
to deposit/to store/to leave in sb's care
to set up/to arrange/to lay out
to park (a car etc)/to moor (a boat etc)/to leave sth (in a place)
